channel.title: I would like to know
channel.description:
[u][b]Are there people with this problem :[/b][/u]
I have no-ip DUC enabled, my run.bat server is running, opened firewall exceptions and opened ports on my router... (btw my router is a modem at the same time, its not a router connected through my modem, its literally a modem and a router at the same time) (i have vista)
The first time i did all of those things, my server was running very well and i had at least 15 people on, but ever since that day, I can't register my server on the status page, because it says my server is off line and i have just proved to you (reader) that it's not off line.
All help appreciated, Mike.

item.title: I would like to know
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“RatedX., post:10, topic:174751”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=235204.msg2439433#msg2439433 date=1221385457]

um yea i did it right… trust me

Um, you didn’t or it’d be working.
[/quote]
It’s a flaw on the status page. ;)[/quote]
Orly?

Read full topic

item.description:
@mackel wrote:

[quote=“BurnInSilence, post:4, topic:174751”][quote author=Hockey4lifexx link=topic=235204.msg2005538#msg2005538 date=1200867660]
u still probably need to port forward…
[/quote]
He said he portforwarded and it worked and everything
He has problems with the server status register gawd
Mackel <3…You know its register once right?
btw i found out that i have to portforward through my IPcop hardware firewall
i feel stupid now[/quote]
lol, go on msn

Are there people with this problem :

I have no-ip DUC enabled, my run.bat server is running, opened firewall exceptions and opened ports on my router… (btw my router is a modem at the same time, its not a router connected through my modem, its literally a modem and a router at the same time) (i have vista)
